page.title: 09Traffic Problems
page.content: The A256 runs from Sandwich to the junction at Whitfield roundabout, (A2 London), and is particularly important as it divides the village into 2 halves. As the road is a major route between the port of Dover and the Isle of Thanet, it is extremely busy carrying port workers and commercial heavy goods vehicles, including car transporters, (one every 10 minutes), moving new cars to depots at Sandwich, waste disposal lorries and bulk coal carriers from Tilmanstone. Everyone living on the west side of the village has to cross this road to get to the library, village hall, school and to visit 2 of the old people's homes. Those living on the east side have to cross to visit the doctors surgery, post office, grocery store and the newsagents.
